ascelion.merkle

Class TreeBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ascelion.merkle.TreeBuilder<T>

  • public final class TreeBuilder<T>
extends Object
    Builder class for a Merkle tree.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TreeBuilder(UnaryOperator<T> hashFn, BinaryOperator<T> concatFn, Supplier<T> zero)
      Constructs a tree builder using the given operators and a supplier of the filler value.
      TreeBuilder(UnaryOperator<T> hashFn, BinaryOperator<T> concatFn, T zero)
      Constructs a tree builder using the given operators and a constant filler value.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Builds a tree from all leaves previously passed to any collect method.

      Creates a Merkle tree from a collection of leaves.

      Create a Merkle tree from an array of leaves.
      TreeBuilder<T> collect(Iterable<TreeLeaf<T,?>> leaves)
      Convenient method to collect leaves; user must then call build() to build the tree.

      Convenient method to collect leaves; user must then call build() to build the tree.

      Convenient method to collect leaves; user must then call build() to build the tree.

      Calculates the hash of the input value using the hash operator of this builder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeBuilder

        public TreeBuilder(UnaryOperator<T> hashFn,
                   BinaryOperator<T> concatFn,
                   Supplier<T> zero)
        Constructs a tree builder using the given operators and a supplier of the filler value.

        Constructs a tree builder that uses arbitrary hash and concatenate functions. Both operators must handle null values if the supplier zero is expected to return null.

        Parameters:
        hashFn - the hash function
        concatFn - the concatenation function
        zero - supplier of the filler value

      • TreeBuilder

        public TreeBuilder(UnaryOperator<T> hashFn,
                   BinaryOperator<T> concatFn,
                   T zero)
        Constructs a tree builder using the given operators and a constant filler value.

        Constructs a tree builder that uses arbitrary hash and concatenate functions. Both operators must handle null if the zero is null.

        Parameters:
        hashFn - the hash function
        concatFn - the concatenation function
        zero - the filler value

    • Method Detail

      • collect

        public TreeBuilder<T> collect(TreeLeaf<T,?> leaf)
        Convenient method to collect leaves; user must then call build() to build the tree.
        Parameters:
        leaf - the leaf to be added to the tree.
        Returns:
        the instance of this builder

        Returns:
        the instance of this builder

      • build

        public TreeRoot<T> build()
        Builds a tree from all leaves previously passed to any collect method.

        The internal state of the builder is cleared afterwards and the builder can be reused to create a different tree.

        Returns:
        the tree

      • build

        public TreeRoot<T> build(TreeLeaf<T,?>[] leaves)
        Create a Merkle tree from an array of leaves.
        Parameters:
        leaves - the array of leaves.
        Returns:
        the tree

      • build

        public TreeRoot<T> build(Collection<TreeLeaf<T,?>> leaves)
        Creates a Merkle tree from a collection of leaves.
        Parameters:
        leaves - the array of leaves.
        Returns:
        the tree

      • hash

        public T hash(T value)
        Calculates the hash of the input value using the hash operator of this builder.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be hashed.
        Returns:
        the hash value of the input value.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(List<T> chain,
                       int index,
                       BiPredicate<T,T> eq)
        Checks whether a hash chain is valid using the operators of this builder instance. The chain must contain both the hash of the node and the hash of the root as described at TreeLeaf.getChain().
        Parameters:
        chain - the validation chain
        index - index of the current leaf
        eq - equality operator for <T>
        Returns:
        true if the chain is valid
